xCR0w9904o0bIx2umty6Hg.text: Delicious salad and cakes, and I would try also Fresh Mix Juice. Price is collect( cafe latte, salad, cake 9£)And Staffs are kind and friendly !

qv6Y5yQPDW0cWMsuSQPW_Q.text: Really great and fresh food hip and relaxed environment. I highly recommend the Sundried tomato and feta quiche and the various salads (tuna, macaroni, and potato). They were really good and inexpensive.

4zWkBG1U1Uv2VSiaMjfWgA.text: Wonderful brunch place in Pimlico. Great selection of fresh juices. Wonderful dishes - savory french toast to die for! Highly recommend! Quite small though and always full! They also have matcha latte - big bonus for me!/

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. They do Matcha Latte!!!
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Avocado on toast with bacon & scrambled eggs!
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Savoury French Toast!!! Cheese, bacon & maple syrup!!! Decadent!

TFsHjJfy3lP-R2xqOO94hQ.text: This is a great spot for weekend brunch, especially if you like a late brunch, or are looking for an American/San Francisco type brunch spot. It can get crowded between certain hours (11am - 1pm), but otherwise seating is easy.The scrambles were delicious - especially the chili and eggs (spicy). The caramelised banana French toast is great for sharing. Coffee was, like everyone else notes, very good quality. Decent service, and reasonable prices for the fair sized portions.

g3oRHwAYUvTo3oTZCy3AKw.text: With generous portions and gluten free options this restaurant was a great find. It was a great way to start our day in London.

FIPtIIObLemvVUDQbboDTQ.text: I like these kind of neighbourhood cafes - chalk writing on the walls kind of places. They had a selection of really nice looking juices - I enjoyed my mango/passionfruit/orange combo although it was pretty heavy on the orange flavour. Also really enjoyed the lasagna with "salad" - the salad was mainly pasta and couscous, an approach to salad of which I heartily approve although overall it didn't blow me away. My friend liked his dish too. The portions were generous & good value for money.There's a few seats outside and the food was brought to us but for some reason the previous customer's coffee cup was not cleared away...other than that the service was really friendly.

KwFxiF1mF5qtV7XBgxQbPA.text: Breakfast was great. Had the sweet French toast and fresh squeezed orange juice. Enjoyed it very much. I wanted to make it back for the savory French toast but want able to make it back.

CZLiH4E2VxlSFvJULXzHvA.text: Learned about this place through Yelp. Our hotel was less than half a mile from it. Our experience was so good we had breakfast there throughout our whole stay in London. We loved the spanish omelette and the sourdough toast was amazing. Place is small, but it makes up for it with great food and service. Highly recommended.

lRBVy2j1gplqsK9G1oAkXQ.text: Later got some meat pies to go. Highly recommended. Yum.

cv5KmvgvB2QMJYflfEvjUA.text: Vegan but very Bacon friendly. Don't let the word Vegan sway you, its not just for veggie people. Case in point, my boyfriend who took a lot of convincing to eat sunday breakfast there is most definitely a meat and potatoes type of guy and he walked away full and satisfied. In the 2.5 years we've been together I have never seen him eat a raw tomato except here. What a feat! Delicious looking treats including muffins and scones. I didn't try them but next time I will. I have tried the porridge, which seemed like the never ending bowl. I barely made a dent in it. It could easily feed 2 people, and it comes with all the fix-ins. The Cheesy bread with bacon was delicious. Not too heavy and the bacon cooked to perfection. The Avo and tomato salad with bacon again, was unforgettable. Really tasty meals here. Go for breakfast, stay for lunch and find yourself wandering there for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Cheesy waffles with Bacon
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. tea
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. inside on saturday morning

89WIF58-J7o9wifWKQWKKQ.text: One of the best breakfast joints I've been to in my entire life. The savory French toast is to die for.

V7wl2cbrl7SPCVqag728zQ.text: In the time between my breakfast and lunch yesterday, I got a craving for a smoothie. A strange craving yes, but one that needed satisfied. My hotel happened to be right round the corner from this cafe so yelp told me, and the reviews encouraged me to head on round. When I got in I instantly liked the place. It has the contemporary chalk on the walls and rustic wooden furniture thing going on, and the food they offer looked absolutely amazing. Ill definitely be going back to try the food out, but yesterday all I wanted was something healthy that would wake me up. I can't remember the exact ingredients of my smoothie, but I'm positive it was blackcurrant, raspberry and ginger. Regardless of what was in it fruit wise, it was deliciously fruity and the ginger gave it a strange but pleasant kick. The staff were chatting away to a couple of regulars, which made me like the place more. Rapport with customers is always a great thing to see. Highly recommended place!

nVPDTThHk3otAvoI5t5QkQ.text: The food here is lovely. Omelets with fresh ingrediants, well prepared.  Porridge is whole grain goodness. But. Kindof unwelcoming. We arrived one hour before closing and they were washing floors, chairs up on the tables and were told takeaway only. Another day, we arrived half hour before closing and told same thing only no hot food.  Pardon me, but if an establishment posts a closing time,that should mean full service until that time.  If you want to start cleaning and limiting service an hour before closing, then just post an hour earlier closing time. Since this happened teo days in one week, Id say that is a pretty routine but poor practice

d2e4Gd4aUibWG3tKXfTSHw.text: Trendy place for breakfast, lunch, coffee or tea.  They also have some great vegan options, like vegan carrot cake and vegan lemon cake.  A bit on the pricier side, but the the coffee is nice and strong.  Pimlico Fresh can get quite crowded on weekends, as it's pretty popular for brunch.  Also, the slices of cake are massive!  Great spot in Pimlico.

zRvARwU9JZWl4x_f_Yrw5g.text: Fresh in every sense of the word. An oasis, even in the ever-improving Pimlico - imaginative and very well executed. Flat white is best in the area. Staff are even rather more friendly than they used to be.

bx9X0Y9xjc9AK5numXcPlQ.text: Came here on our mourning jaunts on our vacation.  The smoothies were fabulous with lots of flavor.  The food case looked amazing but we only tried the smoothies.  I would definitely come back here again. The staff was always friendly and quick service too!

_OeCmB0uRE9_bEYhvTMPNQ.text: Pimlico Fresh recently opened in the old Café DK space on Wilton Road, and I must say, this is a vast improvement! In fact, it can't even be compared... so scratch everything I've written thus far.---- starting over ----Pimlico Fresh is a fantastic little find on Wilton Road, serving up fresh and contemporary British favourites like jacket potatoes, salads, sammies, soups and a few hot specials. The space is as fantastically "crunchy" as you would hope from the name, with a large chalkboard wall with the menu and specials scribbled across, large wooden communal tables, fresh fruit and veg piled up in aesthetically pleasing piles, and even a little section where you can buy some of your fresh organic faves like chocolate and sauces. Oh, and the kicker? MONMOUTH COFFEE. 'Ja hear that? Believe. This place is a true neighbourhood gem, and I can't wait to see the fantastic buzz that builds around them!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

aKX88p9NubpAgeyOGiv-Dg.text: Great venue for anyone looking for brunch, coffee or a deli vibe. It's quite small in there with big wood trestle tables, but everyone gets on fine. The menu is simple but effective - brunch classics, lots of avocado and roasted veg, and some delicious pies/quiches for later in the day. The perfect place for a chilled midday meal.

-66zLAu9q_tVNXPKEY1Rqw.text: It's nice.Not fantastic. Not worth going out of your way for. Just a perfectly downbeat neighbourhood cafe.I've visited Pimlico Fresh on a couple of occasions, mostly when hanging out with a friend in Pimlico and in need of a respectable cup of coffee. Monmouth brews, competently prepared, satisfying. Food looks nice. I've never tried it though, as I mostly live on a diet of caffeine and alcohol.____________________________________Note: Pimlico Fresh does not serve alcohol.

9c9_YrUxoKy-LKqDH9khBg.text: Great place to catch a quick quiche slice and java in the Pimlico vicinity for a late breakfast.

eKFaGO-JImqoFgxCXDb3Ww.text: Came here while on a super short holiday from the US. We could not believe how simple yet how incredibly flavorful each singular ingredient in our dishes were. And the coffee was fantastic. Although we typically don't like going to the same place twice, we're considering breaking this rule on our last day because there were so many other yummy looking items on the menu, and the food on other tables looked really good hehe. Everything was fresh, hearty, colorful, and perfectly cooked. It's a very small place so you have to be patient. But it's well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Sprouted sourdough, avocado, fresh tomatoes, bacon, fried egg. Didnt expect much from something so simple but it was SUPERB!
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Avocado toast, bacon, fried egg. Pesto toast, fried eggs. Both tomatoes on sprouted sourdough. Seasoned perfectly! Simple! DELICIOUS!

hke_DzHXUs3pOEA7xEsvSA.text: Delicious breakfast!Have been looking for a nice place for breakfast during my last visit. Found that amazing cafe. Try the French toast or the scrambled eggs with avocado you won't be disappointed..

OsOm5wpuju1Rmha1UQwO0g.text: While visiting London, I was looking for a local spot that had amazing breakfast especially later in the am and came across Pimplico Fresh.   It was exactly what I was looking for.  Their menu has a lot to over and all very healthy. Go for one of their "things on toast". I had the mushroom, spinach and goat cheese on toast. I added a side of avocado and it was pure delicious. Check this place out. You won't be disappointed. PS their coffee is a must try as well :)

3s5N4CRE-J6SVQ7kt98_ZA.text: I was visiting London for a couple of days and found this place near my hotel, it was amazing. I had the Spanish eggs on a toast, latte and a passion fruit and mango juice and everything was amazing and felt fresh. Service was also impeccable.

otTg05Q3f6d3W5Lom-Ps8A.text: This is one of my favorite places in the neighborhood! Lovely food, coffee, juices and atmosphere. I found this while walking and it's become one of my go-to places for breakfast, lunch, or afternoon coffee. It can get busy on weekends but I have always found it to be an easy going experience every time I go there. Favorites: any of the quiches, mixed salad & spanish eggs. Yet to try the sweets on the menu (next time!).

wHMPM-3fmyHsKlBdPX2kjA.text: I've been here on two different occasions -- once for coffee and pastries, and another time for brunch. Pimlico Fresh met my expectations on both occasions. Everything here is served fresh and flavourful whether it be a cup of cappuccino or a plate of French toast. It's not your poshest presentation, but I can ensure you that this is the brunch next door in your hood at its best. I also love the ambience -- it's cozy and intimate. It does get busy during peak times, though, so expect to wait for seats. Definitely worth a visit on a lazy weekend morning!

pVcgTYxGbUWiUX0d2pX7Xw.text: Went in for breakfast, really good food. I knocked it down a star only because the seating is first come first serve and communal so I ended up ordering food without knowing where I would sit being that all the chairs and tables were taken. (And of course there was the couple sitting outside who had long finished but weren't moving!) By the time the food arrived a couple people had left and with some rearrangement I found a seat. Overall, great food for the price.

7U3gOXyPIourcUVx0_ry4Q.text: Gotta notch it down a bit after my last visit. The service was just not what it used to be. I remember walking into Pimlico Fresh and being greeted with a smile. Not so anymore. I would generally forgive the grumpy staff shuffling around from table to table (it's busy, it's early, I get it) because the food is still pretty decent, but not this time. We arrived and luckily found a table immediately, must've been in between rushes. Ordered 2 coffees and 2 meals. Our coffees came out within 5/10 minutes as usual, no problem. But then we noticed that our food was taking a while. People who arrived about 15 minutes after us were served their food first. So after about 30/40 min, I went up to the counter and inquired about our meals. The response was, "Oh ok, I'll check in the back." Great. 15 minutes later, and still nothing. So I went up a second time and asked again. She said she'd check again. A few minutes later our food appeared - the waitress was curt and not apologetic at all that we waited nearly an hour for our meal.I understand it's busy and that these things happen, but would've expected a more prompt response and better service once we complained. I doubt I'll be returning here. There are better places for brunch.

bC8E4CIw1GB_pbtGKYQstw.text: Freshness served up right! Love the decor and more importantly the food. Great portions of food.  I like the original parings of toast and food. The place is very clean. They definitely are busy and the coffee is awesome.  The sweet french toast was great as well as the Spanish eggs and salmon avocado toast. You won't be disappointed here!

QNUPEJYw9IvF-71OfDYt1w.text: The breakfast was good and freshly prepared.Overall it was very expensive. 28 pounds for two coffee and two breakfast that is over 35 dollars US.It was good. But it's eggs and toast for alot of money

obDTd_OnMz9eT3am2vRriA.text: Very very good food and plenty of choice for a brunch. The place is really small though, so if you plan on eating there, be prepared to wait a bit.

5U39xKrS0h95vNyGxYZQ4Q.text: I went for lunch and it was packed! The food was great. My family and I had the lasagna, savory french toast, and the tortellini. They were all delicious. The place is a little small but cozy. Nice warm envorment! Good food for the whole family. It was excellent!

A46EWNTxFpySIbmaHhNvxg.text: As a few other reviews mention, you MUST get the savory French toast. It's basically French toast with bacon and cheese on top, with the usual syrup. Very tasty! (It was kind of like that first time you gave chicken and waffles--sounds weird, but now you love it.) I was able to stop by for a late breakfast, so the place was almost empty.

EBPNXVtK7W7heman2yQdHA.text: Easily our favorite breakfast spot in London! Get the savory French toast! You must!!!

sglRwOmlJfxiFtwpOQuTYQ.text: We stopped by for breakfast and were very lucky to get a seat, because the few available tables were all packed. You give your order at the counter and wait for them to bring the food. Luckily the wait turned out to be short and we could quickly dig into our variations of toast. I had scrambled eggs, while my girlfriend went for salmon, cream cheese and avocado. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was relaxed. Overall, very enjoyable. I should add that I, contrary to some other reviews here, thought the coffee was far from "the best in london". In fact, i thought it was below average.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

iDMr2B7hx9WFM0_GjF5wUA.text: I went here several times when I used to live close---- every time was amazing. Our go-to brunch place. Both the sweet and savoury French toast are to die for. Coffee is good as well.

loPv9vGHAXNXZtz2r5Wd0g.text: Probably one of my best meals thus far in London. A group of 6 of us came here seeking brunch food (eggs, french toast, etc.) at 1PM. The place was packed, and we had a 20 min wait ahead of us. The woman at the counter suggested we place our orders ahead of time so that our food would be delivered promptly when we sat down. Most of us ordered the eggs on toast, and one friend ordered the caramelized banana french toast.The six of us decided to squeeze at a 4-person table to avoid the wait (there are probably 25-30 seats in total at Pimlico), and sure enough, our food came out pretty quickly!!! I had the scrambled eggs with salmon served on toast, and it was both generous and absolutely delicious. There were two large slices of sourdough topped with large slices of lox and heaps of scrambled eggs. The green onion and freshly cracked pepper garnish topped everything off. I was stuffed before I finished half of the plate, and my friends loved their dishes too. I probably wouldn't get the oatmeal, as one friend did. Great presentation but it looked kind of small (was served in a large cappuccino cup). Lattes were large and satisfying.Tl;dr - wonderful brunch food; long queues, so come early or come late! Will definitely be back.

qsYwIzXK37WmRDcNXd2AYg.text: excelleny breakfast/brunch in London, not far away from Victoria Coach Station. The meal is big, yum yum and not pricey. Food looks gorgeous. Would try the colorful juice next time. Recommene Veggie scrambled egg.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

UYZSa-bve4tIarF0SHA6sg.text: My husband and I had a breakfast here on a recent trip to London and really enjoyed it. The food was yummy and fresh and the tea was absolutely delightful!

r-0svTGGg39VFxfz7reV5A.text: Lovely fresh food and friendly staff. Quite packed at peak times, but visit and you will see why. Brunch is always good, as is a slice of quiche and soup on the way home from work.

6lSWbwZuFmcWFwmBkFLgyg.text: I've been so spoiled with many versions of avocado toast on this trip and Pimlico Freah did not disappoint with the several options on their menu! Food tasted exceptionally fresh and the service was excellent.

YAgR95xaua1EGkhSAgOqGA.text: (3.5) Came here around 9AM Friday morning and we got the scrambled eggs and sweet French toast. You first order and pay and try to find a seat. Seating is very limited so you are literally just waiting around for people to finish eating and hopefully they finish by the time your food is done. The scramble eggs were good, but it literally just tasted like eggs. Nothing special about it. The toast was super hard! It was almost too hard to even eat.The French Toast was good but again there wasn't anything special about it either. Portion size was good tho.-1 for seating situation -.5 for the hard toast If you're in the area and it's not too busy give it a shoot if you like, but it's not something to go out of your way for.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Sweet French Toast
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Scramble eggs with Bacon and toast

STEArvmv3kqjo0xJLNWgCg.text: Visited hear today and it was very busy ,we opted for a window seat and ordered chicken and aubergine stew with wild rice and chicken quiche with a green salad, everything tasted fresh and flavoursome.The staff were really friendly and the food arrived very quickly ,the Pimlico fresh is a buzzy friendly laid back establishment .

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Chicken quiche & green salad
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Chicken & aubergine stew

3HxelIE-b_2As4nzVr13DQ.text: Best food I had in London.  Very clean and fresh tastes.  We had the avocado toasts, lasagna, pasta and other side dishes.  I wanted to have dinner there as well but they close at 3 pm.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Sitting is a bit limited.

qvqStpcNL5ChAJwz8A5IFQ.text: Very simple, but very delicious. Food was fresh, service was wonderful and the coffee hit the spot.

ipHXi6ChUDH_qtEcsiAdmQ.text: We were looking for something other than the standard British breakfast and found it here after reviewing other yelp reviews. The breakfast was very good and even though it was busy, we didn't have to wait very long for the food or coffee. It is more expensive that it should be for the type of breakfast and seating available but they were extremely nice, the food was good, and it is cheaper than some of the alternatives in the same area.

_5JI2z_bv5fU3Z58OtUGuA.text: 6 stars!!wonderful little cafe!! the french toast Savory with cheese and bacon is my suggestion. also of note: steak & mushroom pie and the spanish eggs = delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. cool
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. a definite must for breakfast/brunch
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. spanish eggs

XURRJqKBaphrAc8YgLu7Kg.text: Great food! Breakfast, brunch, or lunch no matter what it's all good. I got the savory French toast and it was huge! Definitely enough to fill someone up! Small eating space, but the food makes up for it!

BXJqIUwh_02DxVAQulVC8w.text: The food is GREAT here! The only negative is that there are no bathrooms on the premises and if you come during a busy time, you'd be hard-pressed to find a table. The food is delicious, flavorful, and comes out super quickly! They also offer an assortment of fresh juices!  They were able to accommodate my friends nut allergy without a problem. They have a few fresh salads to choose from, and lots of great breakfast choices. We both got the veggie eggs and liked our dishes. This is a great, quick spot for breakfast, not too far from Victoria!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Veggie eggs with smoked salmon
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Brown sugar

C1rYw1oMrpEe9zRWlSuVYA.text: Pimlico Fresh offered a nice breakfast option in London. My wife had green eggs. It was a good dish but the pesto could have had a little more garlic. I had the spinach and goat cheese quiche with sun dried tomatoes. The sun dried tomatoes had great flavor and it was a solid quiche. What made it for me was the four different salads you could choose from. Very good cucumber and goat cheese salad.

ztqwM21jMoUoI1V9pmL1cQ.text: They say that the grass is always greener on the other side.  I assure you it is not, as I sit here stirring fresh whole milk into my nice steamy cup of Darjeeling tea.  The ones who have said it must not have been sitting where I am now.  I take a deep breath and the freshness of the earthy greens fill my senses, waking me from a walking slumber.  Right before me is a "Mushroom Spinach n Goat Cheese Toast" and a "Spinach Feta Pine Nut Quiche" made with unmistakably some of the finest n most simple ingredients.  I cut into my toast loaded w fresh wild mushrooms, soft goat cheese, garden spinach, and spinach pesto.  That first bite aroused all my senses giving me a true feeling of satisfaction.  I quickly work my fork into the warm quiche... Ah... Now that's a good quiche.  A light flaky crust embraces the pie w nothing less than love.  Delicious.I can't help but to notice that the sun has arrived at the horizon landing itself onto a table of two.  Yes, although the grass is greener here, I have this urge to leave these green pastures for a brighter setting.  I don't have the courage for it might be possible I'd lay waste to all that I have over the greed of my very eyes.  Portions are big.  What lies on the other side of the horizon is the most lovely golden soft scrambles over toast that makes my mouth water like that of a damsel in need.  Each bite they take makes me wish it was me sitting where they are.  I'm afraid I will never get the chance to encounter such a beautiful scramble here at Pimlico Fresh.  If and when I'm in London again.  I will surely pay another visit.  Experience tells me that next time, my side will be greener and brighter.  A place w such good fresh food and a warm friendly helpful staff, this place will be missed and at one of my top faves for an amazing brunch.  For now, it's one last sip of my warm Darjeeling, and it is off to the Gatwick Airport to return to my homeland.  Farewell London.  My stay was short, but these fond memories are forever.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Leftovers packed to go for the airport... Nothing goes to waste.
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Just past the horizon of the bar top I was sitting at... Those soft scrambles everyone ordered made me yearn for one
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Spinach feta pine nut quiche served warm... Generous portions :) yums

Y0OOOEJ_EcgNUyGfPgXF1Q.text: Delicious food! I got green eggs, which was sourdough bread with two fried eggs, avocado, pesto, tomatoes, and onions. Filling, but not heavy. Perfect lunch place!

ewBV4sWMM7zaHcnRvsLoTA.text: Delicious! Great French toast, delicious fresh orange juice, friendly service! Highly recommend!

3LECleEG-EolC-86oMcEvQ.text: Friendly staff? CheckFresh coffee? Check Tasty pastry? CheckGood sandwiches? Check Menu written on chalk board? Check Close to home? Check I believe this qualifies for a great neighborhood cafe. I've had some really good coffee there. The beef and mushroom pie was amazing. The pie crust was flaky but it didn't collapse when I cut through it. The stuffing was moist and warm. The Spanish omelette was surprisingly big, but we finished all of it. They also serve many different flavours fresh smoothies that seem very popular. I can't wait to go back and try some. It's one of those cafes that no one will go across the town to visit, but you'd feel absolutely blessed if you've got one on your block.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Steak and mushroom pie
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

3qP7249hjljSO8SafU_NOw.text: So I always had a standard with French toasts.. I thought nobody will beat Square One Dining in Los Angeles until I met their French toast with cheese and bacon. I just cannot say how much good it is. It's a big serving so if you eat light, you can share 1 order but cmon now we both know you can finish it up. Thank you Pimlico Fresh and now you are my standard in French toasts.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. French toast with cheese and bacon

6H-UdI_VL9k3vIrwxOmq4Q.text: Great place to grab a quick bite to eat. The name says Fresh and that's exactly what it is. Great freshness to its ingredients and taste. My wife got the salmon avocado toast and I got the mushroom spinach. Both were well made and delicious. I also am a ginger beer lover and this particular brand they sell is great. How did I reach my 4 stars rating? 1 star for location, 1 star for menu, 1 star for food taste, 1 star for service. The last star I give for a truly life changing food experience and this is great food but not amazing. I do recommend anyone to go give it a try if your staying a few days in London you should fit it into your schedule.

I15MCfwXXs1AsuhxYlKP8w.text: We had just moved to a new apartment in the area and we wandered out to see what looked good. This place had a good feeling to it and it was brunch o'clock, so we ventured in.Your attention is drawn to the far wall which is prepared as a blackboard and has the menu. This is a plus for me for this style of restaurant. There is a communal table in the middle which is also something I like. You order at the counter, indicate where you plan to sit and they will bring it over to you when it's ready.There are options covering most tastes, but I went for the traditional bacon and eggs on toast. My wife had the sausages and eggs. Strangely, hers came with two pieces of toast while mine had one, but she gifted me the toast later so I didn't really miss out. For mine the scrambled eggs were overcooked, but the meal was fine.For drinks, I had a flat white and my wife had one of their freshly prepared juices: carrot and orange. These were ok, but I have had better coffee elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Bacon and eggs (the bacon is hiding)
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Sausages and eggs

DCHle0XcuWZ8On1sbSMEAQ.text: Ate here for 2 consecutive days and still planning to pay another visit before we leave London. Quiche Lorraine was so tasteful especially with the bacon bits topping and the size of it is just ridiculously humongous; avocado toast with bacon is to die for; scramble eggs were so soft and juicy; and their fresh squeezed orange juice... you'll definitely regret if you don't give it a try. Overall, strongly recommended this restaurant for a nice breakfast/brunch!

1rYAJaTh8yyUTtJPO3v3sw.text: A friend of mine was in town and we were looking for a nice place for some good breakfast and I can along this one in Yelp. Located in a good location close to Westminster without being touristy. We ordered salmon and avocado on toast, bacon and avocado on toast and some coffee and tea. The staff was really really nice and everything came really quick. The whole atmosphere is lovely and the whole cafe is really nice designed. Most of their food is savoury but they do a couple of sweet cake options too. Our food was amazing, the bread was actual bread and so good! The portions were a bit small for the price but location wise that's what to expect. One star down as there's no toilet and the coffee didn't meet my expectations. I love coffee but had to put sugar into this one as it was too bitter. All in all a lovely little spot where I'll definitely return too!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Bacon and avocado toast
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Salmon, avocado and cream cheese toast
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

2tE1lbk7kHCOKaC7Ky8nOQ.text: For my first visit I ordered a Almond Croissant and a Flat White. The croissant was huge and I basically ate it all day (it was like 2 meals). I would say the croissant was slightly on the harder side, but it wasn't stale. Not sure if all croissants are like this, but I prefer a crispy croissant outside with a soft inside and it fell short of my expectations a bit. The flat white was absolutely delicious. It was my first time trying one, and I must say I found love. For my second visit, I say down with my friends and I must say all of the food looks good! The make you want to drool type of good. I ordered the steak mushroom pie and pumpkin spice soup. They were both pretty good and were very hot. And of course another flat white ;). Highly recommended!

3fCY-q-ynGp7z6CVBlg1lQ.text: We had breakfast here on a Monday morning. I had the homemade granola, and from the very first bite, I regretted that I hadn't ordered more, because it was SO GOOD. However, I was too stuffed once I finished, so I was pretty sad that I couldn't try one of the yummy looking pastries. My aunt loved her almond latte and avocado vegemite toast. All in all, friendly service, reasonable prices, delicious food!

oIxtyHjdxUrTMmyKcLPU4A.text: The food is excellent. Been here several times of different trips and make sure to set aside time to get here for breakfast. There for is always fresh and they Maher fresh squeezed orange juice! Love that. The Chili Eggs are my go to here, but everything I've tried has been delicious. The pastries are delicious as well too. Definitely worth a stop if you're in, per near Pilmco.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Spanish Eggs - Scrambled eggs, chorizo, spinach,  tomato, red onion & feta.
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Chili Eggs on Toast. Delicious.

h_4PImxJvkSl-DeCyq6uag.text: Yum! Our favorite breakfast spot in our trip to London! I tried the green eggs with the pesto on the side as I'm typically not a pesto fan but it was delicious! I also tried the salmon on toast and it was the perfect breakfast for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

eqNbTBDWPM6e6nzRWETK-A.text: I was visiting London for two days and this was the most memorable places I ate at. The store is on the smaller side but the atmosphere is still great. (Even though the store is small, customers tend to cycle through and there is never an awkward moment of standing and waiting for more than 15mins) The chalk board menu different and the food was unique. I always percieved toast as regular toast but this restaurant brought it to another level. I ordered the Spanish Eggs with toast. They were generous with the amount of scrambled eggs and the baby tomatoes were sweet! I would definitely come back here again.

8BCu2oq35JO6SE35jM0GjQ.text: The food is great with lots of veggie/fresh options and fresh squeezed juice. The only reason they get three stars is because of their use of plastic cups and straws. Fresh squeezed Orange Juice and other juices in plastic cups with lids. I asked for a glass and no straw instead of the plastic option and I got two glasses with two straws. I would like this place to rethink their plastic use which would raise them up a lot in my book.

b125GPwKbnIT4y8OyuZV_g.text: Fresh and delicious breakfast for everyone! This little cafe offers a great selection of breakfast either you're in the mood for sweet or savory (we did both!) . They have plenty of vegan options and is happy to accommodate dietary restrictions.  Everything we ordered was delicious and made to order, freshly squeezed OJ and brew coffee available to go with our food as well.

Bpx0_dn3uczwLLAwtKIdkg.text: Quite good modern brunch items on the menu..Had the avocado eggs and the chorizo eggs.A bit on the expensive side but mainly (and I guess this is not their fault) you can almost never get a table while if you do get one your ears are ringing with the murmur.

jVQl4KNDdxsgtzaR1B_WFg.text: Excellent and light lunch. We ordered the green eggs, salmon & avacado toast, stuffed eggplant, and homemade lasagna. All were delicious and of high quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Lasagna - excellent sauce
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Stuffed eggplant
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Salmon and avacado spread on toast

UcDi3LOTFRLvkVm6wDM_MQ.text: I've discovered that London has a LOT of beautiful and healthy food to offer. Pimlico fresh, to me, isn't anything out of the ordinary because there are many healthy options in this city. But hey, if you're willing to give me a plate that I can shove multiple delicious, healthy, vegetarian options on then I'm game! And that's just what I did. I had 4 different salad options, from roasted vegetables, butternut squash, and cold pasta salad. They were delicious, filling, and healthy. We also ordered matcha lattes, something super popular in London. And it was mighty tasty. They've also got a cute wall that's a chalk board where they write their menu options. Thanks Pimlico Fresh. you da bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Pretty flowers!
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Interior-menu on the wall
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Warm quiche with 2 side salads

V_UBYdculCTFfGUBOcxiSA.text: Wow - absolutely amazing brunch place in London! They have good, fresh juices and their cappuccino was great. I had chili and eggs (scrambled) on toast - simply clean and delicious.We ate outside, which was a little bit chilly but the heaters did their job.Service was quick and friendly.I'd highly recommend this place and hope I can return on my next trip to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

E4lFJ5_lVesq2AYWOuNNVQ.text: Great stop for brunch. They don't serves mimosas though. Great selection of breakfast options

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

koYAnuw0rlwIyK6XzGqLBQ.text: I stumble upon this place by accident and I'm glad I stepped in.  The food was fresh, healthy and delicious.

Fw4EGy4_mhJ-9nSy8xuj2A.text: We had a break fast here.Food was good, fresh but not something that you can't make at home.I know London it's an expensive place to live but it's not a reason to take 30£ for a breakfast that it's not really make you full.Nice food but I don't get what I paid for and that why I wouldn't comeback here.

RdN_VB0VHtlfQw-fuLzgRw.text: I love this place . Pimlico Fresh is a very nice place for brunch .Good choices of fresh juices. Great dishes ( trysavory french toats !!!).Come early during week ends. Quiet small andvery busy. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

_IJtyaS8yepIjio1tWHtfQ.text: Pimlico is one of these areas that try to convey elitism, at the same time, not having a lot to offer besides beautiful terraced houses. Bordering with other grander locations of London it faces extreme competition from them, lacking a distinctive character of its own that could be some sort of counterweight.Pimlico Fresh on the other hand brings a new wave of freshness to this a bit tedious district. It's a very small venue and it can be challenging to find a free seat. I believe this speaks itself about its reputation. So if you are planning to come here with a party of 10 people make sure you reserve the whole place beforehand :)If you are patient enough to wait for a seat like we did on that one Saturday afternoon you will be rewarded. Hearty food made straight from the heart. I went for steak and mushroom pie. Home made pastry, salad made with love and attention (you could see from chunks it was completely made from scratch). On top of that, you can get a freshly squeezed orange juice.As a frequent runner, I would suggest this place for a fulfilling healthy and nutritious post-workout brunch whenever you end up in the Victoria/Pimlico area.On the day, this meal followed my earlier swimming workout and that also worked equally well.If you sit at the big table and forget about London conventions you might even be able to have an odd banter with the regulars!I will definitely be back here. I was discussing food with one of the guests and quickly realized that French Savoury Toast looked to die for.This place also works as a great money saver, but that's besides the point. For me, it has already earned 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Steak and mushroom pie

eyJx27NPszW5Nj36RBDNMA.text: Fuego Spanish eggs on toast! This has a great atmosphere and food, small local and tasty!

TJesw6cmRFsYw6zGb8eCfw.text: I've been here twice for breakfast now.  If you plan to stay, first thing you should do is find a seat and drop your stuff.  Then check out the blackboard, as the menu is there, then go back to the front to order and pay.  Good food and reasonably priced for the gentrifying area.

-65cuJOcCDenGNoKekK-nw.text: Great place for lunch, all the ingredients looks very fresh and the staff were extremely helpful. A must visit for the savoury french toast

VHjHFXa4-ETxR-mcLxE6NQ.text: My chai tea latte was very tasty the food was a tad on the bland side. I had the salmon advacado toast and it was beautiful to look at just a bit bland for my taste

JpccJdEPSecEZXaBkS1gpw.text: Delicious food but seating is limited and quite crowded.  Safe was super friendly and warm.  I had the green eggs and loved it.  Beautiful neighborhood

XDzXHZuyM6IdjNOw20Gc9g.text: The food at Pimlico Fresh is outstanding. It's so good we went back twice!We had the chili eggs, sweet French toast, porridge, americano and hot chocolate.  Everything was amazing. The eggs were slightly runny, but still super tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

D2B-u-rjRhlGeKpA-hWq8g.text: Restaurant is cute and decor is farmhouse chic... service is SLOW as hell so if your not ready to spend 2 hours there avoid it.  Food makes up for the bad service

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

vKIGb1jaPgyrbGXRjSlxgw.text: I Really liked this place. The best cafe for a tasty breakfast is served there. Pimlico Fresh is a peaceful place  of a good atmosphere and where you may find tasty dishes. I discovered there, a wonderful toast with avocado and bacon. Everything was delicious! Do not hesitate to visit this cafe.

qbbqsvlVNHZUbgUc21tKhQ.text: This is probably my favorite breakfast place in Pimlico. When you first walk in menu is located on the wall, all fresh juices are on the left hand side. Small restaurant space, however scrambled eggs and selection is delicious. We have ate there twice this week and have enjoyed the Spanish scamble with toast and the Chilli Scramble. Cappuccino served with plenty of foam with powdered chocolate.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

-ILeJDhg9Cgk64WMNG16-A.text: This was my family's go-to breakfast spot during our trip to London.  Some of the dishes I got were the quiche, goat cheese scrambled eggs, and smoked salmon toast which were all great filling breakfasts.  A lot of the dishes come with salad on the side which they had a really great selection of including a roasted veggie and beet salad.  All the drinks we ordered were enjoyable, although for some reason they seemed take a while to come out.  All the women working here were very nice and accommodating.  If I lived here I would definitely continue to be a regular!

OR16mCHO9AkeJNG5sr7_1A.text: We ordered the avocado salsa and bacon toast. The food was quite good and fresh and it cost 8.75 pound. There aren't many seats and unless you're lucky and get a table for yourself, you'll have to share a big table with strangers or just stand in a corner and wait for a spot. The service is ok, nothing out of the ordinary. The place is clean and located near the victoria station.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

ACr7sAEE8CoB2w_5y8UZZw.text: I am a huge avocado-egg-toast eater so I was so happy to have found this place when visiting London. The eggs were cooked perfectly - a little runny, just the way I like it. The avocado tasted so good and fresh. The serving portion here is huge! I suggest sharing with a friend if you're not a heavy eater.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Salmon Avocado Toast with Scrambled Eggs & Green Eggs Avocado Toast with Tomatoes.
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Latte & Cappuccino

10uoap9TRwSmb_t8J2W73w.text: Wow.   French toast with caramelized banana, cinnamon maple syrup with creme fraiche. Yummy.  Cool place

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

bWhD-R4NAU7siyxj9rKZFw.text: This place was tiny and very busy but that's expected for a Sunday morning. The staff was friendly and super efficient. We sat at one of very few tables and enjoyed some eggs on toast. The chilli eggs were perfect over toast. The brioche French Toast was a good pick too. We highly recommend it. I wish I had room to have a yummy treat from the display case at the front counter!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Chilli Eggs

502vhnu-dbzrO0HwyrdSzA.text: I went to Pimlico Fresh for the first time last year, and it definitely lived up to the hype at the time. But then we visited again in June, and the food wasn't as good. We went twice last weekend, and won't be going back. They've substituted volume for quality in their egg dishes, and they are very slow. Yesterday was the capper: we waited 25 minutes for our eggs, even though there were only four customers in the restaurant. When we checked on them, the staff apologized and brought them within a couple of minutes (they'd obviously forgotten them), but the fried eggs were massively overcooked.We'll just go to the Pret around the corner next time. At least it's cheap.

GKO6rcGx3uuG9KxyEKIzVQ.text: We were looking for a fun local spot to have breakfast and Pimlico Fresh was perfect! We enjoyed avocado toast and a cappuccino. The food was amazing! You get so much food for what you pay for...couldn't even finish it! The fresh made juices were just as delicious!

oq8nUlchgWzy2c-3MSG4jA.text: The cafe gets really crowded. So if you want to have a seat, you most probably gonna have to wait. At least, they offer to take down your order before hand and as soon as you have a seat, they'll process it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

DvOjoWKbdTWx-BabA7i5HA.text: This place has an amazingly fresh breakfast with vegi + gluten free options. The ENTIRE selection of handcrafted expresso drinks deserves its own five starts for artisty all by itself. Only con - this spot is super small... But that won't keep us from coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

Wiy9-59TuPqfWzV8yRfEqQ.text: Delicious delicious delicious!! When i visited London back in September 2016 (i know it's been awhile) i had the chance to visit this spot for brunch and i just can't get it out of my head!! I wish i can go back to eat some more!! (From Los Angeles, CA). We arrived at around 10 am in the morning and it didn't seem too packed, but the place is pretty small so just a few tables available therefore we opt to sit outside on the little table (which made for a beautiful photo though). I can't remember what my sister ordered but something with sunny side up eggs on top (photo will be posted) and i order the salmon and avocado toast! both were really delicious!! we also ordered the chicken salad and i'm not sure whether i was hungry or not but it was the best salad i've ever had!! i wish i was there again to try their other dishes! the only downside was when we ate outside we were getting attacked by bees!! it just kept flying towards us and our food!! not sure if there's like a hive nearby or just nature but regardless i know it isn't their fault. unfortunately it did make eating outside unpleasant so we had to move inside after the non-stop attack!

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Tea time
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Salmon toast and chicken salad!

DVGm8781dgx6NUyOjOi62A.text: My wife and I stumbled into this place while visiting London! We were staying a few blocks away and needed a place to hang out before our room was ready. While this place gets very busy, it is a testament to how great it is! We ended up going three times in four days. Their toast and egg combos are all good and the service is excellent! Tip, try to get there before 9 am to beat the crowd.

aaZwv37k3jEpHlmdEn9Afw.text: Perfect breakfast spot to get ready for a day out. I had the flat white and avocado, smoked salmon and cream cheese on toast. Other than it needing a bit of salt, it was perfect. My husband had the mushroom and spinach on toast with sausage and he loved his dish. We sat outside, and it was a lovely experience overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

IDh0URiXDlsODJPmK3zp4Q.text: Best breakfast in the area. Chilli eggs on toast, french toast amazing. Friendly service, we loved it.

DYRoBuZuI4ruWcUPyrWTEg.text: Really liked this place. Quick service and fresh food. I had the salmon with avocado on toast with a nice cappuccino. Pleasant people and worth the solid reviews.

ujIWemDpJoWkOdbAEtqwUQ.text: Fantastic. Had mushroom and spinach with sausages on toast, and chili eggs. Portion size is quite generous but did finish everything. Sausages a bit cold but that is my only complaint. I will try their pastries next.

t8_FQhZ09HQFNOi8vfpIaw.text: So Fresh tasting and filling ... everything looked delicious. Bread was amazingly soft and portion was huge... its a small cozy place with great food. We ordered french toast ,omelette and delicious tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

zcgistfyfj0QIx54M7ResA.text: Pimlico Fresh is a nice small cafe with a rustic feel inside. Sandwiched between a Pret, Starbucks and a Nero Pimlico Fresh is a nice spot for tea and coffee or light quick lunch when you're feeling guilty about western consumerism, ect and want to support a smaller establishment. Breakfast is also good.

VJQdh9W7ckRmTpPTepEEHg.text: The avocado toast I got for breakfast  would have been quite good even  without that juicy strip of bacon on it. If I wanted to convert a vegetarian, this would be the place to go for the kill.

WbOoaAlySItPneNH2kdoVw.text: As a long time (40 years!) Pimliconian, it's been a pleasure to experience the explosion of good places to eat. Pimlico Fresh is the latest good food venture to enhance the nabe--I can only echo the other reviews: lovely fresh food served by charming and obviously talented staff.Next stage: expansion. Such is its popularity that it's already outgrown the premises. Bravo.

FKRzXDQNVWlZ_NgfLk6wIg.text: Menu on the chalkboard on the wall, communal tables, Monmouth coffee, a cupcake, fruit salad with a dollop of fresh Greek yogurt and honey.....you catch my drift?  Kind of following the trend in little neighborhoody breakfast spots.  The food is good although not mindblowing, the service can be slightly spotty and the baristas need more training.  But I do love the ease of gliding in here and the sidewalk tables (with the heat lamps when ya need them).

v76xR9AcK7au2GPfhpl7ig.text: Really lovely decor, friendly staff, Jacqui very helpful in helping to choose from their delightful fresh and different selection of food stuffs.Scrumptious coffee and cakes.You can also sit outside and watch the world of Pimlico pass by!

FdlYIferakkFDLKQEIEPow.text: Great coffee and good smoothies to pick you up. Best place in the area.

uCRI5wZJdgkB55CC1vAjjA.text: I LOVE this place. It's a smart boutique coffee venue that brews Monmouth coffee expertly in relaxed, informal surroundings: benches and large wooden tables with good outdoor seating for the early morning sunshine. Love it - and love the welcome you get there too. Why on earth would you go to Starbucks when you can come here?

qKKSCHdIRvqlMmSRFm1awg.text: The worst thing about this place is how hard it is to get a seat, which should tell you everything you need to know about how great it is :)

YTfjUBgeVFgXf-iy_vgSKw.text: Even though they claim to be open until 18:00, they stop serving most of the food at 17:00. Ridiculous.

v2y55cuuGsskUS6I5tD2yw.text: Found the place on Yelp while on vacation in London. Breakfast was deeeeeelicios! The Spanish scramble and both the French toast sweet & French toast savory were amazing!!! Love the chalkboard menu and family style seating as well. The portions are big enough to share (wished the person at the register would of said so when my friend & I were deciding on what to order). The food is fresh & served quickly. It's NOT cheap but the portions are hearty & deeeelicious!!!

awicZ2VzqJeIct0a6kmpDw.text: Best cup of coffee I had in London. Not a whole lot of seating, but if you go after the busy hour it won't be too crowded. There are lots of good and healthy breakfast options at a good price point. While visiting the city for a week, we liked this place so much we went three times.

_ksYYA8dFHg_0L6sqN6cEQ.text: Great food. Chilli eggs on toast and sweet French Toast. Freshly squeezed OJ, coffee and sunshine outside. Staff was very nice and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom. Chilli eggs on toast and sweet French Toast. Freshly squeezed OJ, coffee.

I0jZZxcGT_pWgLZrXpzIfA.text: Lovely eggs, creamy coffee (Allpress is always nice!) but a bit slow on the service, probably due to the popularity on weekends. I'd suggest trying to go a bit earlier than "brunch" time on the weekend, unless you're happy to wait a bit.

jtLw488Lmes9EjVtRm1ybg.text: Opened earlier this year (2010). This is a upper-middle market deli cafe selling hot and cold dishes made from fresh, organic ingredients. They sell Monmouth Coffee too! Well appointed, fresh white interiors and its tidy, clean presentation lifts the general outlook of Wilton Road eateries. Much welcomed.

photos.caption: Photo of Pimlico Fresh - London, United Kingdom

BM4t0ShbB6EWaitcxaI4Mw.text: Cute little cafe that does the job if you need a fresh lunch in pleasant atmosphere. We went there for lunch but it looked like they had quite an impressive breakfast menu too.The communal tables make for a friendly atmosphere although I do agree with previous reviewers that there is too little seating space. We were sitting next to friendly folks and didn't mind crowding up to fit more, but if you get there late lunch hour you might end up with nowhere to sit. The staff was friendly and laid back. Overall, my impression was that this was quite a no fuzz eating space where you found men in suits and hipsters alike.The food was simple and fresh but still interesting. I had the chicken pastilla to which I could choose various salads from their salad bar. The coffee was excellent and the treats as well.

Xu7ct_uhC8C-D6Z2Ui9YTQ.text: Lovely little cafe with a friendly atmosphere. The wood tables and benches are shared with other diners, yet it still is a comfortable place to carry on a conversation with a friend. I had the savory French toast (something I'd never tasted or even heard of before): thick slices of cheesy toast topped with bacon and maple syrup! It was delicious, but next time I might order what my friend had which was also very good. She let me have a bite- chilli eggs on toast. Yum. They have an interesting breakfast/brunch menu. It's definitely nice to find a unique place like this near the touristy craziness of Victoria station.

4aMIxGoXKqot2OGcJO5g2A.text: We have been meaning to try Pimlico Fresh, and today was the day! We opted fro takeaway, but next time I think it will be dine in. For lunch today they had on the chalk board steak and mushroom pie with a salad which my hubby got and I went for the not on the chalk wall but in the case and looking amazing Tuna Nicoise salad.We were both thrilled with our choices. His came with a heaping salad of beets, feta, peas, butternut squash and greens in a nice light dressing. The pie was full with steak, mushrooms and a nice sauce.My salad was exactly what I wanted. The green beans were firm, the eggs properly hard boiled and a nice balance of tomatoes and capers. The tuna was just the right amount. I did add a bit of balsamic and oil at home, but I am wondering if they would have had a dressing on hand. I also added half a baguette at home since it didn't come with any bread. But had we eaten in they had loads of breads to choose from to add on for a price.All in all this is a great spot to grab a quick bite. As I waited for the takeaway I saw people of all kinds come in and order and everyone looked satisfied.

UJACKDpbihV8VJrtIj8pAA.text: I ate here twice this weekend.  Food was great both times, the coffee was perfect and the staff was super friendly.  Their eggs on toast are plentiful and the Spanish Eggs on toast were killer!  Wish I could go back sooner!

BNcr6X4S9cVDoWo8xAVjpg.text: Yes the food here is great - read the other reviews.BUT... you'll be lucky to get a seat. The two main reasons for this are:1. The kitchen takes up way too much floor space which means there is no room seats and tables.2. Rather than putting chairs and tables in, which can be pushed together for larger groups, they have gone for uber trendy and highly unpractical big wooden dining tables. This means if there is space to sit, you are usually sat far too close for comfort to random strangers. And given that this is in prime yummy mummy territory - good luck tackling the buggies!p.s - the fruit toast is fantastic!

KtJcb9VsFjdCfXDjvszj_w.text: I walked in and noticed that the chalkboard indicated that they served Monmouth coffee!  I then had no choice but to order a latte.The food is good and fresh.  If you order a sandwich it's made on the spot.  The atmosphere is friendly and nicer than the Starbucks and Nero franchises next door.  There are not many chairs, but everyone seemed to find a place.  I will definitely go back.

aInBtcBzrK7PANGOhmO0pA.text: New to the neighborhood, this small cafe serves the ever-popular Monmouth coffee, along with a long list of breakfast, lunch and even dinner delicacies. Most of the selection (did I mention fresh squeezed orange juice?) is up front so you can eye before buying. Though I've yet to get through most of the selection, I've been more than pleased with the porridge and mixed berries (perfect rainy London weather food). The staff is fast and friendly and the small number of long tables gives the space a cozy atmosphere, though if you're planning to have a heart to heart this isn't the place to get personal.Bonus: I feel even better ditching nearby Nero every time I order my cappuccino and get a customer loyalty stamp.

vhOqz1YvXu70mZVo1C5ayQ.text: Loved the Thai green chicken curry with veggies on rice.....and coffee was yummmm too....

PfXCCyT-qQ4JI2x0bUWsWQ.text: Prompt, attentive service, good food and coffee served up within 10 minutes. I'm a fan!

hNyUmWvaXEZ7-RuT7gmu5g.text: Whenever I move to a new neighborhood or city, part of my ritual is to find a decent café with comfy seating, yummy treats and most importantly good coffee. In London, that place has become Pimlico Fresh for me. I seriously heart Pimlico Fresh so much that I kina wish I could fold it up and take it back to SF in my suitcase, but for now I'll settle for it being my little Pimlico outpost. When I found out the neighborhood we'd be living in was kind of removed from the city center and a bit bougie, I was worried that there wouldn't be great veg options, but Pimlico Fresh has come to the rescue. They fulfill all three of my requirements and then some:1. Cute communal seating (a great way to have a nice conversation with someone new or just chill and read a book)2. Delicious fresh food including amazing vegan soups (Thai lentil the other day was rich and tangy), yummy vegan brownies (this is a hard one to perfect, I know I've tried!), and other assorted salads and muffins for veggie peeps.3. Very good soy lattés (very important for the functionality of my brain). All that being said it has its quirks. One is that there is no public bathroom, which can be a bit of a pain if you want to settle in for a nice afternoon of reading with a cup of tea. Second, they seriously need some wifi up in there. Is this not a thing in London? Other than that P-fresh (yah, I said it!) rocks my socks. I definitely recommend it for veggie peeps and omnis alike and it will certainly be missed when I return to the states.

qQY09DTh90Q35VNXSQLTzg.text: Perhaps the best Cappucino I've ever had in my life!  True to its name, everything is fresh, and more or less wholesome, whether you go for a freshly blended vegan energy drink or a sinfully delicious slice of cheesecake.  Delightfully friendly and attentive staff, cozy quarters and a truly local feel.  Can't go wrong here!

ZX_Bi5BwlOB9acGBedhenw.text: Wow, this place reminds me of New York. It's got a somewhat hipster, somewhat Australian vibe, with a noveau old school ambience. For example, I was sitting at an intentionally unvarnished wooden table. Why not varnish the table? Because it feels older that way! The food was absolutely delicious here... I had baked eggs, and it was very solid. I could say it was some of the best baked eggs I've ever had, but it wasn't that much better than any other good baked eggs I've had. There were bits of chorizo in there, which I find awesome. I wouldn't mind if all my food came with bits of chorizo. They told me it would take 20 minutes to bring out the baked eggs, but it took about 14. It also came with toast that was perfectly buttered. Like the butter was already melted and distributed through the toast. And the nearest jar of Vegemite was just a few feet away. Booyah. I am coming back to you Pimlico Fresh.

C6i-zLXh-MkhaavWU_oCKA.text: A-OK is my verdict of this place. Yes the food is reasonable, quite pleasant even. But it's also rather pricey and there's not a huge amount of space to sit. I like what Pimlico Fresh is aiming for, but I think there are better places in and around Wilton Road.
